Value conversions

Detailed Description

Functions that convert between C types and Values.

xxx_V converts an xxx to a Value. V_xxx converts a Value to an xxx, throwing an exception if the Value is not of that type. UNSAFE_V_xxx is like V_xxx but does no type checking. (Use only when speed matters and you can prove the type is correct.)


Functions

Value INT_V (int i)
 Converts an int to a Value. Be aware there are only 30 significant bits in an integer Value!

Value CHAR_V (short uc)
 Converts a Unicode character to a Value.

Value BOOL_V (bool b)
 Converts a bool to a Value (false becomes V_NIL, true becomes V_TRUE).

Value REAL_V (double d)
 Converts a double to a Value.

int UNSAFE_V_INT (Value v)
 Converts a Value to an integer with no type check.

int V_INT (Value v)
 Converts a Value to an int. Throws if Value is not an integer.

int V_CHAR (Value v)
 Converts a Value to a Unicode character. Throws if Value is not a character.

bool V_BOOL (Value v)
 Converts a Value to a bool. Result is false if Value is V_NIL, otherwise true.

double V_REAL (Value v)
 Converts a Value to a double. Throws is Value is not a number.

Value REAL_V (  double    d ) 
 

Converts a double to a Value.

int UNSAFE_V_INT (  Value    v )  [inline]
 

Converts a Value to an integer with no type check.

Quickly converts a Value to an integer *without* testing the type first -- use only if you're sure the Value is an int (or it doesn't much matter if it isn't).

int V_INT (  Value    v )  [inline]
 

Converts a Value to an int. Throws if Value is not an integer.

int V_CHAR (  Value    v )  [inline]
 

Converts a Value to a Unicode character. Throws if Value is not a character.

bool V_BOOL (  Value    v )  [inline]
 

Converts a Value to a bool. Result is false if Value is V_NIL, otherwise true.

Converts a Value to a double. Throws is Value is not a number.
